description: The tall sharinga trees of the Mwangi Expanse leak golden sap from their swollen, bulbous trunks, which coagulates when exposed to air.

name: Living Thunderclap
description: A living thunderclap is a humanoid-shaped storm cloud that cracks and booms with thunder.

name: Living Waterfall
description: Living waterfalls are humanoid-shaped columns of churning water.

name: Living Whirlwind
description: A living whirlwind resembles a roughly humanoid-shaped dust devil.

name: Living Wildfire
description: Living wildfires appear as humanoids made of living fire.

name: Lizardfolk Defender
description: The lizardfolk defender serves as a protector of the young, guardian of the settlement, and when no other options are available, soldier in time of war.

name: Lizardfolk Scout
description: Iruxi scouts are the lizardfolk most often encountered by adventurers, for these explorers and hunters spend most of their lives on the move, constantly patrolling the territories held by their enclave.

name: Lizardfolk Stargazer
description: The tradition of astrology and looking to the stars for both navigation and prognostication is well-established in iruxi society, and their wise and observant stargazers are among the people’s most respected members.

name: Luminous Ooze
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 85
description: Luminous oozes are strange globular creatures that glow with brilliant multicolored light.

name: Lunar Naga
description: Lunar nagas are skilled diviners and astrologers whose dark scales and white hair sparkle with motes of light that mimic the night skies to which they are forever drawn.

name: Lurker In Light
description: These malicious and strange fey appear as fairies about 2 feet tall, with insectile wings, large eyes, and bulbous heads.

name: Lyrakien (Wanderer Azata)
description: Lyrakiens are musical messengers and embodiments of free travel.

name: Magma Scorpion
description: Whether skittering through Abyssal wastelands or basking in the searing sand of the deepest deserts, magma scorpions have charred carapaces constantly emitting vision-warping waves of heat.

name: Mammoth
description: Found mostly in colder climates, mammoths are accustomed to dealing with desperate and dangerous predators, trampling and crushing their enemies while using their larger tusks to greater effect.

name: Mandragora
description: A mandragora looks like a freshly pulled tuber that has grown into the malformed shape of a child with a grotesque face and hideously bloated body.

name: Manta Ray
description: While manta rays might appear daunting, they are generally docile.

name: Manticore
description: The manticore is a monstrous amalgamation of lion, dragon, and human with a penchant for feasting on human flesh.

name: Marid
description: Marids are capricious but powerful genies from the Plane of Water; among geniekind, they are rivaled in power only by the fiery efreet.

name: Marilith (Pride Demon)
description: Mariliths are the generals of the Abyss, formed from the souls of proud evil mortals, often warlords and despots.

name: Marrmora
description: On the First World, marrmoras dwell in ruined wildlands perpetually scourged by fire and rarely, if ever, travel elsewhere.

name: Marsh Giant
description: Dwellers of brackish coastal salt marshes and fetid bogs and swamps, marsh giants are hideous in appearance indeed, with fishlike mouths, slimy gray-green skin, and dark, beady eyes.

name: Marut
description: A marut is tasked with hunting mortals who cheat death by artificially extending their lifespans.

name: Mastodon
description: Not to be confused with the larger mammoth, mastodons are primeval elephants who dwell predominantly in temperate forests.

name: Mechanical Carny
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 86
description: Mechanical carnies are constructs manufactured to serve as entertainers, cleaners, and guards at carnivals and circuses.

name: Medusa
description: Monstrous humanoids that resemble humans with snakes instead of hair, medusas are best known for their petrifying gazes that—if lingered upon—can permanently transform mortals to stone.

name: Megalania
description: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey.

name: Megalodon
description: Prehistoric sharks of incredible size, strength, and ferocity, megalodons scour waters deep and shallow to sate their considerable hunger.

name: Megaprimatus
description: The megaprimatus is among the mightiest of apes, quick to confront any perceived intrusions into its domain.

name: Meladaemon (Famine Daemon)
description: Meladaemons personify death by starvation and thirst, and revel in spreading the same despair that brought about their mortal demise.

name: Melody On The Wind
description: This cloud of song and sound has been caught by the wind and carried across the air.

name: Merfolk Warrior
description: Merfolk warriors form the bulk of the militias of their vast underwater realms and meet potential aggressors head-on with uncompromising force.

name: Merfolk Wavecaller
description: Merfolk wavecallers use their primal power to call forth allies and defend their people with deadly magic.

name: Mimic
description: Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects.

name: Minotaur
description: Minotaurs are master hunters that dwell in cunning labyrinths or tangles of underground caverns meant to disorient and demoralize prey.

name: Mist Stalker
description: The tentacled mist stalker shrouds itself in a cloak of mist through which its single, never-blinking eye can see with clarity, allowing it an advantage when stalking its prey.

name: Mitflit
description: Mitflits, also known as mites, are self-loathing and pitiful cowards, easily bullied into servitude by other creatures or even slightly more powerful mitflit leaders.

name: Mohrg
description: The weight of murder wears heavy on the soul.

name: Mokele-Mbembe
description: Mokele-mbembes are large, reptilian predators found deep within Golarion’s jungles.

name: Monadic Deva (Soul Angel)
description: Monadic devas stand vigil along the River of Souls as it passes from the mortal realm into the Ethereal Plane.

name: Moonflower
description: These enormous plants have thick, knotted trunks festooned with fanged blossoms.

name: Morlock
description: Originating from humans long lost from the world of light, morlocks are brutal monsters that dwell in the tangled tunnels of the upper reaches of the Darklands.

name: Morrigna
description: Bounty hunters and investigators, morrignas seek out creatures that thwart death or interfere with the natural flow of souls.

name: Movanic Deva (Guardian Angel)
description: Movanic devas are stewards of the flow of good creatures' souls through the cycle of life and death, from the point a creature is born to the day it dies.

name: Mu Spore
description: A mu spore is a thankfully rare fungoid monstrosity of vast power and strange intellect.

name: Mudwretch
description: In its resting form, a mudwretch looks like a large puddle of thick, dark mud, heaped at the center in a slightly drier patch of loam.

name: Mukradi
description: Fearsome centipede-like creatures, mukradis are three-headed predators with a devastating array of breath weapons.

name: Mummy Guardian
description: The majority of mummies were created by cruel and selfish masters to serve as guardians to protect their tombs from intruders.

name: Mummy Pharaoh
description: While mummy guardians are undead crafted from the corpses of sacrificed—usually unwilling victims—and retain only fragments of their memories, a mummy pharaoh is the result of a deliberate embrace of undeath by a sadistic and cruel ruler.

name: Muse Phantom
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 81
description: For performers who die before their time and whose love of the theater is stronger than death’s grasp, the show does indeed go on.

name: Muurfeli
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 78
description: Whereas typical djinn can cleanse or clear areas with their arcane winds, the air magic of muurfeli is tainted by the Black Desert's noxious radiation and mixed with the realm's ambient fetid winds.

name: Nabasu (Gluttony Demon)
description: Nabasus are birthed directly into the Material Plane from the Abyss, an invasive infestation that releases the newly formed and ravenously hungry demons directly into the midst of their favored prey: mortal life.

name: Naiad Queen
description: Naiad queens rule over pristine wildernesses centered on untouched lakes or other bodies of fresh water.

name: Naiad
description: Naiads protect streams, ponds, springs, and other natural bodies of fresh water.

name: Najra Lizard
description: Among the smallest breeds of dragon on Golarion, these savage, cunning hunters dwell near the oases that dot the inhospitable Narhari Desert in Vudra.

name: Nalfeshnee (Boar Demon)
description: Nalfeshnees are huge, corpulent, boar-headed demons that hoard treasures and knowledge alike and form from the souls of avaricious mortals.

name: Naunet
description: Pugnacious and powerfully muscled, naunets serve as scouts and rank-and-file troops of protean armies.

name: Necrophidius
description: Although the necrophidius is a mindless construct with no particular ability to comprehend the complexities of good or evil, these sinister-looking constructs are often crafted by evil or macabre creators seeking to imbue their guardians with a frightening aesthetic.

name: Neothelid
description: This gigantic, mauve worm has a hooked mouth with multiple circular bands of teeth and four barbed tongues.

name: Nereid
description: Nereids are aquatic fey with deep ties to water.

name: Nessian Warhound
description: Believed to be bred by the Prince of Darkness himself within vast kennels in the infernal realm of Nessus, Nessian warhounds are the favored guards and hunting hounds of powerful fiends and, rarely, those mortals who worship them and have earned their favor.

name: Night Hag
description: Night hags are thieves and merchants of mortal souls.

name: Nightmare
description: Nightmares are flaming equine harbingers of death.

name: Nilith
description: The sleek, dark niliths resemble hairless, emaciated tree sloths.

name: Nixie
description: These aquatic fey often guard ponds, rivers, lakes, and springs, protecting their bucolic homes from the advances of predators and careless humanoids alike.

name: Norn
description: Ancient beyond imagining, norns are powerful fey women who hold in their hands the physical manifestation of fate and destiny in the form of golden thread.

name: Nosoi
description: A nosoi resembles a whippoorwill, sparrow, or other small bird wearing a heavy leather plague doctor’s mask.

name: Nuckelavee
description: When pollution despoils a natural waterway, it draws the dreaded nuckelavee to it from the First World.

name: Nuglub
description: The "towering" hunchbacked nuglubs are among the largest gremlins, though they're not quite three feet tall.

name: Nyogoth
description: Little more than a coiled mass of intestines encircling a massive gaping maw, this qlippoth is an Abyssal scavenger, subsisting on the filth and leftovers of demons and qlippoth alike, although it relishes any opportunity to consume living prey.

name: Obsidian Golem
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 80
description: The art of golem animation is not limited to societies with access to expensive crafting materials or a long history of arcane mastery.

name: Ochre Jelly
description: Ochre jellies are animate masses of protoplasm with a sickly combination of yellow, orange, and brown hues.

name: Ofalth
description: Found in castle dung heaps, city dumps, and sewers, ofalths are thought to be cousins of shamblers.

name: Ogre Boss
description: In ogre society, might makes more than right—it makes the rules.

name: Ogre Glutton
description: Ogre gluttons take the act of feeding to a horrific extreme, capable of extending their already cavernous mouths wide enough to gulp down a halfling.

name: Ogre Spider
description: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants.

name: Ogre Warrior
description: The simplest of ogres are slabs of muscle with hatefully beady eyes, misshapen visages, and malformed bodies.

name: Olethrodaemon (Apocalypse Daemon)
description: Even daemons fear the most massive and terrifying of their kind, olethrodaemons.

name: Onidoshi
description: Onidoshi, or ogre mages, are oni with the material form of an ogre.

name: Ooze Mephit
description: Slick in every sense of the word, ooze mephits are unapologetic sycophants, shamelessly flattering anyone they may be able to con a favor out of, although their lack of intelligence and subtlety means that only the most vain or trusting targets fail to see through their honeyed words.

name: Orc Brute
description: If orc armies are rarely well organized, this shortcoming can likely be traced to the furious and undisciplined rank-and-file brutes who make up the bulk of an orc warband.

name: Orc Warchief
description: When orcs raid, the strongest is chosen as the leader, backed up by brothers, sisters, and other immediate family.

name: Orc Warrior
description: The typical orc warrior is a violent combatant familiar to many adventurers.

name: Orca
description: While many know orcas as “killer whales,” they are actually the largest species of dolphin.

name: Oread
description: Elemental earth laces through the bones of oreads, who appear similar to stone statues of their mortal ancestry, with delicate crystals in place of hair, fur, or scales.

name: Ostiarius
description: Ostiariuses, as emissaries of the velstracs, tend to the portals between the Shadow Plane and the Material Plane.

name: Osyluth (Bone Devil)
description: An osyluth is an unparalleled inquisitor that revels in the sadism and torture for which Hell is so well known.

name: Otyugh
description: Lords of sewers, ditches, and landfllls, otyughs are   lthy monstrosities that stomp about on three massive legs in search of tasty garbage and refuse.

name: Owlbear
description: With the body of a powerful brown bear and the keen senses of an owl, the owlbear is a dangerous territorial predator, fearlessly attacking any creature that strays into its domain.

name: Pachycephalosaurus
description: Pachycephalosauruses are normally peaceful herbivorous dinosaurs, but they grow much more violent during their mating season, when they fight one another to win over mates and warn away interlopers.

name: Pegasus
description: The pegasus is a winged horse prized for its capacity to serve as an aerial mount.

name: Peluda
description: Peludas are wild and savage dragons that favor reedy marshlands, sparsely forested bogs, and river valleys for lairs.

name: Peryton
description: The peryton is an amalgam of horror, merging the features of a stag, wolf, and hawk.

name: Petitioner
description: When a mortal dies, their soul travels to the Boneyard in the Outer Planes where they are judged by Pharasma, the goddess of the dead.

name: Phistophilus (Contract Devil)
description: Contract devils are clerks, scribes, and bureaucrats of Hell rarely found outside the infernal courts, and then almost always to pursue potential contracts, tempting mortals to sell their souls in exchange for achieving their worldly desires.

name: Phoenix
description: The phoenix is a primordial bird made of heat and flame that dwells in the most inhospitable regions of the desert.

name: Piscodaemon (Venom Daemon)
description: Scions of death by poisoning, piscodaemons are cruel even by daemonic standards, delighting in slow and painful suffering.

name: Pit Fiend (Tyrant Devil)
description: When an army of devils invades to bathe a region in bloodshed and hellfire, it is likely that one of Hell’s most powerful and diabolical generals, the pit fiend, masterminded the incursion.

name: Pixie
description: Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves.

name: Plague Zombie
description: Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions.

name: Planetar (Justice Angel)
description: The beings of righteous fury known as planetars are known to be the least patient of angels.

name: Pleroma
description: Among the most powerful of all the true aeons, pleromas are a manifestation of the duality of creation and destruction.

name: Polar Bear
description: Polar bears are known for their pale fur, with black eyes, lips, and toe pads.

name: Poltergeist
description: When a creature dies, and for whatever reason its spirit is unable or unwilling to leave the site of its death, that spirit may manifest as a poltergeist: a restless invisible spirit that is still able to manipulate physical objects.

name: Poracha
description: Porachas are feline beasts native to the mystical Forest of Spirits in Tian Xia.

name: Precentor
description: Velstrac storytellers and historians are known as precentors.

name: Pteranodon
description: Pteranodons are quick and agile reptiles with 20-foot wingspans that enable them to hover on wind currents for hours.

name: Pugwampi
description: Mean, dog-faced, and craven, pugwampis take disproportionate enjoyment from the accidents and missteps of other creatures—something that happens often due to the supernatural aura of ill fortune these gremlins project.

name: Purple Worm
description: The purple worm is the most common and infamous of the cave worms, a much-feared monster wandering the twisting tunnels of the Darklands that is capable of carving out entire cave systems.

name: Purrodaemon (War Daemon)
description: Few creatures embody war's sheer amount of bloodshed and loss of life as deeply as the purrodaemons, deacons of war.

name: Quasit
description: Unlike other demons, quasits are formed when a mortal spellcaster sheds a portion of their own sinful soul to create a familiar or companion.

name: Quatoid
description: Quatoids are peculiar, mysterious elementals native to the Plane of Water that resemble four-tentacled octopuses with eerily humanoid faces on their mantles.

name: Quelaunt
description: This three-armed, three-legged monster has no discernible eyes, nose, ears, or mouth or no visible means of ingesting food.

name: Quetz Couatl
description: These sacred feathered serpents tirelessly serve the powers of law and good.

name: Quetzalcoatlus
description: Quetzalcoatlus are the largest flying members of the pterosaur family and are often mistaken for dragons due to their immense size and 40-foot wingspans.

name: Quickling
description: Few creatures can match a quickling's speed.

name: Quoppopak
description: Quoppopaks combine the most terrifying aspects of water striders, octopuses, and vampire bats into one evil, water-dwelling monster.

name: Qurashith
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 82
description: Qurashith—or “gluttonwings” in the Common tongue—are fearsome, bat-like predators that haunt the upper reaches of Gluttondark’s cavern-worlds.

name: Radiant Warden
description: The enigmatic and strange radiant wardens were constructed thousands of years ago to protect observatories and scholars against the incursion of alien aggressors from the Dominion of the Black.

name: Raja Rakshasa
description: When not disguised as a humanoid, the raja rakshasa has the head of an animal.

name: Rat Swarm
description: A swarm of rats can cause total chaos within a household or business.

name: Ratfolk Grenadier
description: Ratfolk grenadiers use alchemy and stealth to defend their communities.

name: Raven Swarm
description: A flock of ravens is known as an unkindness.

name: Ravener Husk
description: Raveners require a steady diet of souls, and a ravener that's unable to feed for too long eventually cannibalizes their own soul.

name: Ravener
description: The ravener presented here was once an ancient red dragon.

name: Raven
description: These omnivorous birds are cunning and opportunistic scavengers.

name: Redcap
description: Redcaps are sadistic and capricious fey who thrill in bloodletting and murder.

name: Reef Octopus
description: The common reef octopus is a risky but valuable catch for coastal fishers.

name: Reefclaw
description: Reefclaws are aquatic monsters that resemble huge shrimp or lobsters.

name: Remnant of Barzillai
description: Though the Silver Ravens defeated the evil tyrant Barzillai Thrune before he could fully realize his goal of becoming a genius loci, remnants of his spirit remain throughout the Ravounel region.

name: Remorhaz
description: A remorhaz is an enormous arctic predator that resembles a multilegged insect with draconic features.

name: Revenant
description: Revenants are obsessed, undead stalkers who arise from their own murders and are driven by only one thing: revenge against their killers.

name: Rhinoceros
description: Rhinoceroses are short-tempered, territorial, and easily startled, and these traits combined with their innate ferocity means their natural instinct when disturbed is to attack.

name: Riding Dog
description: Riding dogs types include larger dogs, such as mastiffs, wolfhounds, and huskies, and are bred often by halflings and gnomes to serve as mounts.

name: Riding Horse
description: This entry did not have a separate description for the creature.

name: Riding Pony
description: This entry did not have a separate description for the creature.

name: River Drake
description: Although the glistening scales and sleek, fin-like wings on these drakes give them an appearance reminiscent of river   sh, they are actually distant relatives of the black dragon.

name: Roc
description: Legendarily massive raptors capable of carrying off elephants as prey, rocs are typically about 30 feet long from beak to tail and have a wingspan of 80 feet or more.

name: Roper
description: To all but the most sharp-eyed underground explorers, a roper appears to be nothing more than a large stalactite, stalagmite, or pillar of ice.

name: Rune Giant
description: Magically crafted and bred by ancient wizards, rune giants are anathema to and tyrants among their own kind, who were given power to command and magically control other giants.

name: Rusalka
description: These androgynous, river-dwelling fey delight in manipulating the emotions of those unfortunate enough to fall into their grasp, using humiliation to break their victims' wills.

name: Rust Monster
description: Found in lost dungeons, deep caves, and abandoned mines, rust monsters are a bane to any adventurers who rely on armor, weapons, or other metal items.

name: Sabosan
description: Sabosans are evil, intelligent, bat-like humanoids who live in warm forests and drink the blood of other creatures, particularly people.

name: Sacristan
description: Sacristans are failures among the velstracs, creatures whose bodies and minds have been utterly broken by the velstracs' torments.

name: Salamander
description: Salamanders have serpentine lower torsos, but humanoid upper bodies with toothy reptilian snouts.

name: Sand Sentry
description: Shifting back and forth between a detailed likeness of a human and a muted and featureless bipedal form, this creature of pure sand moves with an eerie grace.

name: Sandpoint Devil
description: While some creatures have been fused to create a new entity that's graceful and beautiful, the Sandpoint Devil is the opposite.

name: Sard
description: An immense, gnarled, tree awoken with raw, primal power by one of the fey Eldest of the First World, this monster—one of the legendary Tane—skitters on huge, spidery roots and thrashes its branches as fiery lightning courses within its blackened bark, a living manifestation of the violent clash between ancient forest and stormy sky.

name: Sarglagon (Drowning Devil)
description: Sarglagons dwell in Hell's myriad waterways, lakes, and oceans.

name: Satyr
description: To a satyr, life is a party and everyone is invited.

name: Saurian Warmonger
description: These saurians adopt warfare as their primary role and greatest calling.

name: Saurian Worldwatcher
description: The longest-lived saurians favor introspection and take the long view of things—though this thoughtfulness should not be mistaken for weakness.

name: Scarecrow
description: A ramshackle collection of materials in a human shape, the scarecrow construct is indistinguishable from a normal scarecrow until it slowly creaks to life.

name: Sceaduinar
description: Strange creatures born from jagged crystals in the heart of the Negative Energy Plane, sceaduinar are fueled by its negative energy and driven to extinguish all life.

name: Scorpion Swarm
description: While a single scorpion is itself a menace, swarms of these vermin can be outright devastating.

name: Scythe Tree
description: Malevolent, vicious, and cruel, scythe trees pose as normal trees near deep forest paths, where they wait to slaughter passersby.

name: Sea Devil Baron
description: Unlike in many cultures, the highest-ranking sea devils are expected not just to wade into battle alongside their brethren, but to actively lead the campaign.

name: Sea Devil Brute
description: Physically imposing sea devils are equipped with some of the best weaponry the community can find, though most are happy to rend their foes using tooth and nail.

name: Sea Devil Scout
description: Scouts, among the lowliest (and most disposable) of sea devils, ply the inky waters of the ocean in search of aquatic prey, tread ashore to gauge landborne threats, or charge into battle with the advance forces of a greater sea devil war party.

name: Sea Drake
description: Long and slender, sea drakes have fins down the length of their backs and webbing between their talons, making them just as adapted for gliding through ocean waves as the skies above.

name: Sea Hag
description: Sea hags kill and eat fishers and sailors who come near their lairs, torment coastal dwellers with dark promises and vague threats, and enjoy the act of causing distress and discord in small towns.

name: Sea Serpent
description: These fabled beasts resemble massive snakes with long rows of finned spines down their back.

name: Sea Snake
description: These lithe snakes like to frequent the shallow waters of tropical seas.

name: Sewer Ooze
description: These amorphous masses of sewage and other detritus make their way through filthy culverts beneath cities large and small.

name: Shadow Drake
description: Shadow drakes are typically among the smallest and least powerful of their species.

name: Shadow Giant
description: Shadow giants are fierce natives of the Shadow Plane, where they have dwelled in perpetual twilight for millennia.

name: Shadow
description: The mysterious undead known as shadows lurk in dark places and feed on those who stray too far from the light.

name: Shaitan
description: Hailing from the Plane of Earth, shaitans are proud and brazen genies.

name: Shambler
description: Shamblers are cunning carnivorous plants that resemble heaps of wet, rotting vegetation.

name: Shemhazian (Mutilation Demon)
description: Shemhazians rise from the souls of torturers and those who reveled in mutilating the physical bodies of their victims.

name: Shield Archon
description: Shield archons defend the fortresses of Heaven against fiendish incursions.

name: Shining Child
description: Shining children are wicked, enigmatic monsters that roam remote planes and untraveled corners of the universe in search of esoteric lore.

name: Shoal Linnorm
description: Shoal linnorms occupy rocky shoreline shallows and slither along lonely coastlines.

name: Shocker Lizard
description: These brightly colored reptiles share the rough size and pack mentality of guard dogs, roaming in small groups.

name: Shoggoth
description: Although even raving fanatics and doom-saying prophets desperately claim the monstrous shoggoth is nothing more than a drug-induced vision or a thankfully unreal nightmare, the truth is altogether more dire.

name: Shoggti
description: Shoggti travel to other planes in roving bands to capture and charm victims, bringing them back to the Abyss where they are enslaved for unknown—but no doubt insidiously evil—purposes.

name: Shoony Hierarch
description: For all their advancement in agriculture, horticulture, and animal husbandry, shoonies subscribe to a remarkably antiquated form of leadership; the role of hierarch is normally inherited, passed on to the oldest living child of the village’s previous hierarch.

name: Shoony Militia Member
description: If shoonies had their way, war would cease to exist altogether, but they know this isn’t likely.

name: Shoony Tiller
description: Nearly all shoonies in a given settlement are farmers, fishers, or foragers.

name: Shuln
description: Scourges of the upper Darklands, these enormous, mole-like monstrosities slice and burrow through solid stone with massive forearms and adamantine-strong claws.

name: Siege Shard
source: Pathfinder #157: Devil at the Dreaming Palace pg. 84
description: Sieges provoke lingering feelings of confinement and desperation.

name: Simurgh
description: Desert-dwelling people consider the sight of a simurgh a herald to a lifetime’s worth of luck, and those who are unfamiliar with the majestic beast might mistake it for the avatar of a deity.

name: Sinspawn
description: Sinspawn were created by one of seven ancient wizards known collectively as runelords—each of whom embraced and embodied one of seven sins.

name: Skaveling
description: Hideous necromantic rituals give rise to skavelings, or ghoul bats, monstrosities that are not true ghouls but instead are specifically crafted undead creatures.

name: Skeletal Champion
description: These skeletons retain the cunning they possessed in life.

name: Skeletal Giant
description: The reanimated bones of giants make excellent necromantic thralls.

name: Skeletal Horse
description: Skeletal horses are sometimes used as mounts by other undead or monsters.

name: Skeletal Hulk
description: Huge giants and other enormous creatures make powerful skeletons.

name: Skeleton Guard
description: The most common skeletal minions are mere guardians.

name: Skinstitch
description: Skinstitches' hulking frames are made from flayed humanoid skin stuffed with straw and poisonous insects.

name: Skrik Nettle
description: The expansive skies of the First World are home to skrik nettles—delicate, bizarre-looking creatures that resemble large jellyfishes.

name: Skulk
description: The cowardly and lazy skulks live on the fringes of organized societies and steal from others without a second thought.

name: Skulltaker
description: Swirling down from misty peaks and through howling mountain passes like an evil wind, the vortex of bones known as a skulltaker is a terrible manifestation of the delirium and agony experienced by doomed climbers and lost trailblazers just before they met their end.

name: Skum (Ulat-Kini)
description: The most numerous of the alghollthus are the ulat-kinis, a servitor race created from human stock to serve as rank-and-file soldiers in alghollthu armies.

name: Slime Mold
description: A slime mold appears as a mound of earth and detritus covered in a thick layer of fungus that exudes a faint stink of decay.

name: Slug
description: These massive, primeval relatives of ordinary slugs squirm slowly through swamps and grasslands.

name: Slurk
description: The slurk is a sticky, tusked frog-beast found in underground lairs and caves.

name: Smilodon
description: Smilodons are large saber-toothed cats, apex predators that are significantly more muscular and broader than the other species of big cats.

name: Snapping Flytrap
description: The snapping flytrap is a ravenous, carnivorous plant that is quick to bite at any creature that passes by.

name: Snapping Turtle
description: Snapping turtles are freshwater reptiles with a long flexible neck, a sharp piercing beak, and a confrontational temperament that doesn't prevent some spellcasters from choosing these creatures as familiars.

name: Sod Hound
description: Sod hounds are mossy extraplanar canines formed of packed dirt and pebbles.

name: Solar (Archangel)
description: Solars are among the greatest of all angels, ranking just below empyreal lords.

name: Soul Eater
description: Only the most desperate or foolhardy conjurers call upon the aid of these strange fiends from the inky swamps of Abaddon.

name: Soulbound Doll
description: Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal’s soul.

name: Soulbound Ruin
source: Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City pg. 85
description: Those who tread in ruined places sometimes speak of a sense that a supernatural presence is there alongside them, as if the spirits of the dead were watching intently.

name: Spark Bat
description: Spark bats congregate around volatile weather in the Plane of Air.

name: Spear Frog
description: The spear frog is named for its toxin, which is traditionally used to envenom thrown projectiles like spears and daggers.

name: Specter
description: When an evil mortal creature dies, it sometimes returns to haunt the area of its death as a specter, a hateful remnant, always seeking to slay others—particularly humanoids—in an attempt to distribute its pain among as many souls as it can.

name: Sphinx
description: Sphinxes are mystical beings with the body of a lion, the wings of a great bird, and the upper torso and head of a human.

name: Spider Swarm
description: An abundance of food, the sudden hatching of a clutch of eggs, or magical influence can cause smaller spiders to gather in terrifying, deadly masses.

name: Spinosaurus
description: The spinosaurus is more than just one of the largest carnivorous dinosaurs—it's also one of the most unusual in appearance, with a large, sail-like fin running along its spine.

name: Spiral Centurion
description: These mechanical constructs were created to serve as guardians in an ancient and bygone era, although exactly who made them and the secrets of their construction have long since been lost to history.

name: Spirit Naga
description: In naga culture, the foul-tempered, unkempt spirit naga holds a contemptible place similar to that of hags in humanoid cultures.

name: Spiritbound Aluum
source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 83
description: Whereas most aluums are animated by the souls of volunteers loyal to Katapesh, the Pactmasters created a handful of more capable (and deadly) aluums powered by the souls of a dozen or more dangerous criminals.

name: Sportlebore Swarm
description: A swarm of sportlebores is a much more dangerous foe than a single insect.

name: Spriggan Bully
description: The typical spriggan is a bully who prefers to take live prisoners in fights, but only to ensure that they have a large stock of living victims to torment, tease, and abuse.

name: Spriggan Warlord
description: While the leaders of larger spriggan enclaves tend to be uniquely trained warriors with highly specialized skills, spriggan warlords are fond of the traditional spriggan weaponry of morningstar and crossbow, valuing this traditional fighting style for its simplicity and for using both weapons to their full potential.

name: Sprite
description: Common sprites are primeval guardians that latch onto a person, place, or object and defend it for their own inscrutable reasons.

name: Star Archon
description: Embodiments of the virtue of prudence, star archons serve as philosophers and administrators, and in times of war as the tacticians, strategists, and generals of archon armies.

name: Steam Mephit
description: These brash and arrogant creatures are among the more energetic mephits.

name: Stegosaurus
description: The stegosaurus is easily recognized by its twin rows of diamond-shaped dorsal plates that run down its spine, and thick tail adorned with four large spikes.

name: Stingray
description: Found in salt or fresh water, stingrays are normally passive creatures, but when threatened or cornered, they lash out with their tails to lance foes with their toxic stingers.

name: Stone Giant
description: Stone giants are stoic, reclusive herders and artists who have a rich history and collection of traditions.

name: Stone Golem
description: Stone golems are slow and steady constructs typically carved from marble or granite.

name: Stone Mauler
description: These towering heaps of earth can inflict tremendous damage up close and from afar.

name: Storm Giant
description: Storm giants are looming but benevolent stewards of sea and sky, often serving as the natural guardians of tropical islands, coastlines, or rocky archipelagos.

name: Storm Lord
description: Storm lords wage battles to claim important territory within the Plane of Air.

name: Striding Fire
description: An embodiment of the speed and chaos of a spreading blaze, a striding fire appears as a lithe and long-limbed humanoid composed of shifting-hued flames churning within a skeleton-like framework.

name: Stygira
description: Withered hermits wrapped in tattered rags, these scarred, eyeless creatures command strange secrets of the earth and interpret the fateful energies of the subterranean depths.

name: Succubus (Lust Demon)
description: Succubi are manifestations of the sin of destructive lust, and they are the most attractive of all demons—as befits their role in seducing mortals to fall to sin.

name: Suli
description: Because their genie forebears are native to the Material Plane, sulis (scions of mortals and jann) are by and large the most common geniekin on the Material Plane.

name: Sunflower Leshy
description: Sunflower leshys are the ambassadors and social leaders of their kind.

name: Sylph
description: Born with elemental gales coursing through their breath, sylphs are wispy planar scions whose bodies seem caught in a perpetual, gentle breeze.

name: Taiga Giant
description: Taiga giants prefer a nomadic lifestyle, both to keep from depleting any one area's resources while satiating their massive appetites and to satisfy a constant wanderlust.

name: Taiga Linnorm
description: Taiga linnorms are covered in hundreds of quill-like black spines as sharp as spears.

name: Tallow Ooze
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 83
description: Pale yellow and smelling of meat, this unnatural, globular monster is composed entirely of rendered animal fat.

name: Tarn Linnorm
description: Although more powerful linnorms exist, the multi-headed tarn linnorm can wreak an awe-inspiring amount of devastation.

name: Tarrasque, The Armageddon Engine
description: The most powerful spawn is Tarrasque, whose legend spread across countless worlds beyond Golarion.

name: Tatzlwyrm
description: Tatzlwyrms resemble human-sized snakes with two arms and a dragon's head.

name: Tendriculos
description: These strange amalgams of plant and fungus with animal tendencies form where the natural world is corrupted by foul magic or frayed planar boundaries.

name: Tengu
description: Crow-like humanoids, tengus are a canny and clever people who can be found across all of Golarion.

name: Tenome
description: A tenome resembles an eyeless humanoid with rumpled, pale skin and a single eye embedded in each palm of its cadaverous hands.

name: Teraphant
description: Though teraphants may resemble an elephant from afar, teraphants lack the long incisors that mark other pachyderms.

name: Terotricus
description: The legendary terotricus is a massive slime-mold that hails from the Abyss.

name: Thanadaemon (Death Daemon)
description: Also known as the deacons of death, thanadaemons represent death via old age.

name: Thanatotic Titan
description: Thanatotic titans served as assassins in the war against the deities.

name: Theletos
description: Theletoses maintain the balance between fate and free will.

name: Thrasfyr
description: As bizarre in appearance as they are ferocious, thrasfyrs resemble six-limbed bears with bull-like horns, draconic scales, and a fire-breathing serpent for a tail.

name: Thulgant
description: Although they spend most of their time hunting and battling demons for control of the Abyss, thulgants amuse themselves with a variety of diversions, such as maintaining galleries of petrified mortals or building massive, hive-like lairs filled with enslaved minions.

name: Thunderbird
description: Thunderbirds bring storms on their wings.

name: Tick Swarm
description: This swarm of thousands of fist-sized ticks forms a moving carpet of bloated insects—a nauseating and intimidating sight.

name: Tidal Master
description: Tidal masters use their power over waves and water to drown their enemies.

name: Tiefling
description: Tieflings are planar scions with fiendish blood.

name: Tiger
description: Tigers are solitary and territorial hunters, using their striped hides to blend into the forests and jungles they call home and preferring to attack with surprise.

name: Titan Centipede
description: These colossal, solitary centipedes claim vast hunting grounds.

name: Tixitog
description: Tixitogs are a species of bizarre aberrations that make their homes in the dens of giant spiders.

name: Tor Linnorm
description: Tor linnorms dwell in the tallest volcanic mountains, either within natural formed caverns or within molten craters.

name: Totenmaske
description: Spawned by the same unnatural and self-destructive obsessions that drove them when they were alive, totenmaskes are the undead remnants of the most self-indulgent and sinful among us.

name: Treerazer
description: Treerazer, the self-styled Lord of the Blasted Tarn, is a powerful demon on the cusp of ascending to the true power of one of the rulers of the Abyss itself—a demon lord.

name: Triceratops
description: Triceratopses are muscular quadrupeds with powerful but short legs, thick necks, and heads crowned by a wide, bony frill.

name: Triton
description: While sometimes understandably mistaken for merfolk—both species live underwater and have a blend of features from both humans and fish—tritons have two legs instead of a tail.

name: Troll King
description: Some trolls have learned the skills necessary to survive well beyond the typical life expectancy for their kind and rally others to follow their lead.

name: Trollhound
description: Trollhounds are squat, slavering beasts akin to trolls in canine form.

name: Troll
description: Common trolls are dim-witted, gangly giants who stalk the fringes of civilization.

name: Trumpet Archon
description: Trumpet archons are messengers, emissaries, and storytellers—embodiments of the virtue of kindness.

name: Twigjack
description: Maladjusted forest denizens, twigjacks form from the cruel and prankish combination of fey and the very woods in which they reside.

name: Two-Headed Troll
description: Two-headed trolls are savage, dual-minded monsters with an unquenchable thirst for bloodshed, and dread tales of their ravenous appetites are whispered of in homesteads throughout the lands of the Inner Sea.

name: Tyrannosaurus
description: Widely regarded as the king of the dinosaurs, the tyrannosaurus is a massive predator with a wide mouth filled with viciously sharp teeth.

name: Tzitzimitl
description: Due to their affinity for darkness and apocalyptic terror, tzitzimitls are widely feared as harbingers of death and destruction.

name: Umonlee
description: Those who dwell in the coldest climates of Golarion tell of a brutal beast that swims through the ice and snow and can devastate entire villages in minutes.

name: Undine
description: Undines are infused with elemental water—the churning power of the briny deep flows through them.

name: Unicorn
description: Symbols of grace and purity, unicorns resemble proud and noble horses.

name: Unseen Servant
description: This creature can be summoned with the spell Unseen Servant.

name: Urdefhan Dominator
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 83
description: Urdefhan dominators control the minds of others to glean useful secrets and gain an advantage against their enemies.

name: Urdefhan High Tormentor
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 82
description: An urdefhan cult's best tormentors can advance to become truly formidable daemon summoners.

name: Urdefhan Hunter
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 82
description: Urdefhan hunters serve as their cults' trappers, hunters, and poachers.

name: Urdefhan Tormentor
description: Urdefhan spellcasters with a knack for the divine are invariably unholy worshippers of daemonkind, typically taking on one of Abaddon's Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse as their patron deity.

name: Urdefhan Warrior
description: From the moment they are born, urdefhans are prepared for war.

name: Uthul
description: An uthul most often appears to be a dark, swirling cloud filled with flying debris and streaked with sudden flashes of lightning.

name: Vampire Bat Swarm
description: Although the typical vampire bat has a wingspan of 7 inches and doesn’t pose a significant threat to larger prey alone (and indeed, these blood-drinkers can feed without their sleeping victims ever noticing), some unusually aggressive species of these bats hunt in deadly swarms.

name: Vampire Count
description: Vampire counts rule their demesnes through a mix of fear and cruelty.

name: Vampire Mastermind
description: Vampire masterminds are evil wizards who control entire cabals of the undead and instill fear in the hearts of mortals far and wide.

name: Vampire Spawn Rogue
description: Vampires use their spawn for infiltration and reconnaissance.

name: Vampire Squid
description: Vampire squid are neither undead nor blood drinkers.

name: Vampiric Mist
description: Though they're often mistaken for vampires in gaseous form or an unusual type of air elemental, vampiric mists are in fact strange aberrant life-forms.

name: Vanth
description: Protecting the Boneyard are the stern and resolute guardians of the dead known as vanths, psychopomps who resemble skeletons with raven-like wings and a mask resembling a vulture's skull.

name: Vaspercham
description: The darkly intelligent vaspercham, an aquatic horror who delights in violence and destruction, lurks in the shallows near shorelines.

name: Vaultbreaker Ooze
description: Though many oozes hunt among the dreary confines of underground caverns, dungeons, and abandoned ruins, others seek to quell their hunger in areas well-trafficked by civilized creatures.

name: Vavakia
description: Juggernauts of destruction, vavakias are formed from the souls of mortals who extract, enslave, or consume the souls of others.

name: Vazgorlu
description: The arthropod monstrosity known as a vazgorlu makes its home on the Astral Plane or inside of a stable portal, ambushing creatures that travel there using dimensional magic.

name: Veiled Master (Vidileth)
description: The powerful vidileths are the insidious veiled masters of the alghollthus.

name: Velociraptor
description: A smaller cousin of the deinonychus, the velociraptor is a swift, cunning pack hunter.

name: Veranallia (Rebirth Azata)
description: Veranallias represent the freedom of life to grow, change, and adapt.

name: Verdurous Ooze
description: Verdurous oozes are found in temperate forests, warm jungles, or other places where plant life grows in abundance.

name: Vermlek (Worm Demon)
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 82
description: Vermleks, also called worm demons, manifest from the souls of mortals who desecrated the dead, such as grave robbers or necromancers.

name: Vexgit
description: These gremlins are covered head-to-toe by a crustacean-like exoskeleton that clacks and rattles whenever a vexgit moves.

name: Vine Lasher
description: What first appears to be a simple shrub suddenly stirs to life.

name: Violet Fungus
description: At a glance, a violet fungus might seem to be little more than an unsightly and sickeningly purple mushroom of unusual size.

name: Viper Vine
description: A voracious, flesh-eating carnivore, the viper vine has a single enormous blossom arising from a thick, leafy tangle of snake-like vines.

name: Viper
description: Each member of this family of venomous snakes has long, hinged fangs that inject potent venom in their prey.

name: Viskithrel
description: One of the many horrid life-forms native to Zevgavizeb's Abyssal realm of Gluttondark, viskithrels—or “gluttonraptors”—are tireless hunters resembling tentacled theropods.

name: Vitalia
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 84
description: Foul occult magic, rare alchemical reagents, and copious amounts of spilled blood are the keys to creating a vitalia—also known as a heart horror— though thankfully the exact means of their creation has been long forgotten.

name: Void Zombie
description: A void zombie arises when a humanoid dies from an akata's void death affliction.

name: Voidworm
description: Other proteans don’t consider the flying, iridescent beings known as voidworms to be part of a protean caste at all, but instead merely a shameful side effect of the Maelstrom’s constantly churning energy.

name: Vrock (Wrath Demon)
description: When the gates to the Abyss swing wide, the first demons through are often vrocks, vulture-headed scions of rage who wheel through the air on black wings or dance with the exultation of their fiendish power.

name: Vrolikai (Death Demon)
description: Unlike other demons, the dread vrolikai doesn't form from a sinful soul—they instead manifest from a nabasu once the nabasu finally satisfies their hunger and returns to the Abyss, and as such vrolikais suffer from no vulnerability associated with a specific sin.

name: Vrykolakas Ancient
description: Vrykolakas ancients are the sinister overlords of their kind, stealing blood, breath, and life to feed their immortal hunger.

name: Vrykolakas Master
description: Vrykolakas masters are sinister shapechangers.

name: Vrykolakas Spawn
description: Vrykolakas unleash their spawn upon the world to spread terror, plague, and suffering and to draw attention away from their masters.

name: War Horse
description: This entry did not have a separate description for the creature.

name: War Pony
description: This entry did not have a separate description for the creature.

name: Warg
description: Wargs hunt in packs and surround their prey like common wolves, but their cunning and penchant for taunting victims makes them easy to distinguish from their less-intelligent cousins.

name: Warsworn
description: A warsworn is an animate mass of corpses composed of dozens, sometimes even hundreds, of victims of battle.

name: Wasp Swarm
description: Wasp nests are made of chewed wood fibers foraged from the surrounding flora, which the wasps make into a material similar to paper.

name: Water Mephit
description: Water mephits are consummate jokers who are always happy to trade a favor for a good laugh.

name: Water Orm
description: Legendary creatures lurking in remote lakes, water orms always find their way into the tavern tales of lakeside communities.

name: Water Yai
description: Among the most powerful yai are those who emulate the form of storm giants.

name: Web Lurker
description: Web lurkers, known also as ettercaps, are ugly monsters that not only dwell within the lairs of spiders and swarms, but actively cultivate and shepherd such vermin.

name: Wemmuth
description: Fertilized by large quantities of spilled blood, such as that found on bloodstained battlefields or in the war-torn regions surrounding besieged cities, wemmuths are vile swaths of vines that draw sustenance from mortal suffering, lapping up blood like water.

name: Wendigo
description: Wendigos are incarnations of the fears of starvation, loneliness, and fatal exposure to cold weather.

name: Werebear
description: Unlike many other types of werecreature, a werebear does not become malevolent during its involuntary transformations, but is instead filled with righteous conviction.

name: Wereboar
description: Wereboars tend to be aggressive and stubborn, and often live with their own kind in small, remote communities.

name: Wererat
description: Wererats tend to be selfishly opportunistic, avaricious, and paranoid as a result of their curse.

name: Weretiger
description: These ferocious werecreatures stalk prey with the cunning and skill of a true apex predator.

name: Werewolf
description: The curse of the werewolf—known as lycanthropy to many—instills in its carriers the hungry bloodlust and predatory instincts of the wolf.

name: Wight
description: Wights are undead humanoids that, much like wraiths, can drain the life from living creatures with but a touch.

name: Will-o’-Wisp
description: Malevolent balls of colored light, will-o’-wisps haunt lonely marshes and forests where they lure unsuspecting travelers into danger.

name: Winter Wolf
description: Winter wolves are related to wargs, but are larger, smarter, and far more dangerous.

name: Witchfire
description: Manifesting as a sinuous form wreathed in sickly green flames, this incorporeal undead forms when a powerful hag or witch dies in agony or rage.

name: Witchwyrd
description: Witchwyrds conceal most of their faces, leaving only their eyes unmasked.

name: Wolf
description: Wolves live and hunt in packs, which, contrary to popular belief, are not led by the strongest in the group, but typically consist of a mated pair, their pups, and juvenile offspring from previous mating seasons.

name: Wolverine
description: Wolverines resemble small bears, to which they are related.

name: Wood Giant
description: Wood giants are the denizens and protectors of the deepest, most primeval forests in the world.

name: Wood Golem
description: Wood golems are often given vaguely humanoid shapes, almost as if cobbled together from scraps of firewood and discarded burls.

name: Wooly Rhinoceros
description: Even bulkier than their non-woolly cousins, these rhinoceroses have a shaggy pelt of long, thick fur and a huge crescent-shaped horn.

name: Worm That Walks
description: This worm that walks was a cultist of the Great Old One Hastur in its prior life.

name: Wraith
description: Wraiths are malevolent undead who drain life and shun light.

name: Wyrmwraith
description: Wyrmwraiths rise from the souls of dragons who refuse to accept death or have an irrational fear of the afterlife.

name: Wyvern
description: A wyvern is a venomous drake with a well-earned reputation for impatience and aggression.

name: Xill
description: Xills visit the Material Plane, where they're often known as ethereal stalkers, primarily to maraud and to kidnap creatures back to their native Ethereal Plane.

name: Xilvirek
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 84
description: Xilvireks are the result of the strange evolution that takes place in Zevgavizeb’s Abyssal realm.

name: Xorn
description: These squat, rotund elementals have three legs, three arms, three eyes, and one massive maw, which they fill with the gems and metals they find so delicious.

name: Xotani, The Firebleeder
description: A monstrosity of living flame and magma, Xotani may be the weakest of Rovagug’s spawn, but it remains a formidable threat.

name: Xotanispawn
source: Pathfinder #149: Against the Scarlet Triad pg. 91
description: Xotanispawn are monstrous versions of scavenging beetle larvae that have been corrupted and mutated by feeding on the remains of Xotani the Firebleeder, a slain Spawn of Rovagug buried beneath Pale Mountain in Katapesh.

name: Xulgath Bilebearer
source: Pathfinder #151: The Show Must Go On pg. 87
description: While many xulgaths impose their will by strength or sheer numbers, some resort to more nefarious—and grotesque—means to take care of matters.

name: Xulgath Deepmouth
source: Pathfinder #155: Lord of the Black Sands pg. 85
description: Xulgath deepmouths wield the powers of the Abyss against their clutch's enemies and invoke righteous fear in their followers.

name: Xulgath Gutrager
source: Pathfinder #154: Siege of the Dinosaurs pg. 85
description: Xulgath gutragers exhibit more extreme developments along the same physiological path as their bilebearer cousins.

name: Xulgath Leader
description: Xulgath leaders are usually the strongest, most violent members of a community—although in some cases, particularly in larger groups, xulgath tribes are led by powerful demon cultists or other monsters who seek to use the xulgaths as servants or slaves.

name: Xulgath Skulker
description: Xulgath warrens are patrolled—some might say “haunted”—by the community’s skulkers.

name: Xulgath Spinesnapper
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 84
description: Xulgath physiological diversity doesn’t always imply drastic change; some xulgaths are simply much larger and stronger than their clutchmates.

name: Xulgath Stoneliege
description: Stonelieges are xulgaths magically infused with living earth—the very bones of the world.

name: Xulgath Thoughtmaw
description: Xulgath thoughtmaws are inheritors of the xulgaths' ancient psychic legacy.

name: Xulgath Warrior
description: Xulgath warriors strike with fury and eager cruelty, always ready for the next fight.

name: Yaganty
description: Yaganties are lean, hairy humanoids with lanky torsos, horned heads, and bulbous black eyes.

name: Yamaraj
description: The greatest judges among the psychopomps are the massive yamarajes, whose wisdom is legendary and whose edicts are unappealable except to ushers or Pharasma herself.

name: Yellow Musk Brute
description: A creature transformed by a yellow musk creeper's tendrils boring into its brain becomes a yellow musk thrall if it's Small or Medium, or a yellow musk brute if Large (a Small creature becomes a Small thrall rather than a Medium one).

name: Yellow Musk Creeper
description: Made up of thick, green vines with numerous yellow flowers, the yellow musk creeper grows at places where the ground is enriched with spilled blood and corpses, like battlefields and graveyards.

name: Yellow Musk Thrall
description: A creature transformed by a yellow musk creeper's tendrils boring into its brain becomes a yellow musk thrall if it's Small or Medium, or a yellow musk brute if Large (a Small creature becomes a Small thrall rather than a Medium one).

name: Yeth Hound
description: Wicked canine creatures who live for the thrill of the hunt, yeth hounds often serve evil masters as guardians and trackers.

name: Yeti
description: Nearly a myth, the yeti is rarely seen—and even when it is, it is often too late.

name: Young Black Dragon
description: Murderous tyrants of marshes, swamps, bogs, and fens, black dragons terrorize their domains with intense fervor.

name: Young Blue Dragon
description: Blue dragons are the sleek and poised cosmopolitans of the chromatic dragons.

name: Young Brass Dragon
description: Brass dragons are whimsical tricksters who delight in humor and play.

name: Young Brine Dragon
description: Brine dragons are usually blue-green in color, with shiny scales, crests that help them glide through the water, and sweeping neck frills.

name: Young Bronze Dragon
description: Bronze dragons are among the most common of metallic dragons and the most likely to ally with mortals on worthy quests.

name: Young Cloud Dragon
description: At heart, cloud dragons are wanderers, explorers, and travelers who enjoy nothing more than seeing new lands and meeting unusual creatures.

name: Young Copper Dragon
description: Capricious and always eager to share a good laugh, copper dragons are among the wiliest of the metallic dragons, but this by no means interferes with their mission to spread freedom in oppressive lands.

name: Young Crystal Dragon
description: Good-natured but vain, crystal dragons are beautiful creatures with brilliant hides made of multicolored crystal and gemstone.

name: Young Gold Dragon
description: Gold dragons are the epitome of metallic dragonkind, unrivaled in their strength as well as their wisdom.

name: Young Green Dragon
description: Green dragons are the most contemplative of the chromatic dragons as well as the most approachable.

name: Young Magma Dragon
description: Magma dragons have a reputation among other dragons for being unpredictable and brash.

name: Young Red Dragon
description: The largest and most powerful of the chromatic dragons, red dragons are a menace to civilizations everywhere, and their strength is rivaled only by their arrogance.

name: Young Silver Dragon
description: Silver dragons are among the most chivalrous of all dragonkind; they wield frost and cold as weapons, can walk on clouds, and dwell high upon snowy mountain peaks or deep in steep, misty valleys.

name: Young Umbral Dragon
description: While the other primal dragons hail from the Elemental Planes, the cruel and unceasingly malicious umbral dragons originate in the depths of the Shadow Plane.

name: Young White Dragon
description: The most feral and least intelligent of all the chromatic dragons, white dragons are brutish, predatory, and chiefly motivated by self-preservation.

name: Zaramuun
description: Zaramuuns are beings of elemental sand that hide in deserts and wastelands.

name: Zebub (Accuser Devil)
description: Zebubs serve as Hell's messengers and spies.

name: Zelekhut
description: A zelekhut is a bounty hunter and executioner.

name: Zephyr Hawk
description: Zephyr hawks drift among the currents of the Plane of Air in great flocks.

name: Zombie Brute
description: Necromantic augmentations have granted this zombie increased size and power.

name: Zombie Hulk
description: These towering horrors are animated from the corpses of monstrosities.

name: Zombie Shambler
description: A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups.

name: Zomok
description: Mighty plant-dragons, zomoks prowl the woodlands, defending their homes from destructive forces while healing and restoring the woods following natural disasters and ravaging intruders.

name: Zrukbat
source: Pathfinder #157: Devil at the Dreaming Palace pg. 85
description: Zrukbats resemble long-limbed bats with gangly wings, which make them clumsy fliers.

name: Zuipnyrn (Moon Mole)
source: Pathfinder #152: Legacy of the Lost God pg. 85
description: This spectacularly odd creature appears every now and again in various traveling circuses around the Inner Sea.

name: Zyss Serpentfolk
description: Even the least among zyss serpentfolk consider themselves greater than any mammal.

name: Acolyte
description: Underling clerics are still learning the tenets of their faith and answer to a superior priest.

name: Acrobat
description: Acrobats perform feats of agility, balance, and strength.

name: Adept
description: Adepts have unlocked only the most minor occult mysteries of the universe.

name: Advisor
description: Trusted counselors of the court, advisors whisper words of guidance in the ears of those in power.

name: Antipaladin
description: There is perhaps nothing more anathematic to peace than an antipaladin.

name: Apothecary
description: Surrounded by bottles and bins of crushed herbs, curative minerals, and potent extracts, the apothecary skillfully combines materials into unguents and medicines.

name: Apprentice
description: Ambitious apprentices can be found in all cities.

name: Archer Sentry
description: Archer sentries slightly outrank the rank-and-file guards, taking positions on walls, garrisons, and other important locations where they can stay out of the fray and pick off criminals or assailants.

name: Assassin
description: Assassins commit murder, either for pay or due to their belief in a cause, such as a religion or a political movement.

name: Astronomer
description: Different cultures have created stories of the hows and whys of the universe, if things exist beyond the stars, and if the gods manipulate the heavenly bodies.

name: Bandit
description: By setting ambushes and traps in concealing countryside, such as forests and mountains, bandits waylay travelers and plunder their valuables before disappearing back to their wilderness hideouts.

name: Barkeep
description: Barkeeps are often friends and mentors within a community, lending an ear while supplying libations.

name: Barrister
description: Barristers may serve as criminal prosecutors or as legal advocates, defending the rights of those accused of crimes or named as defendants in civil cases.

name: Beast Tamer
description: Beast tamers bring the wild to civilization, rearing and training creatures to follow their commands and perform flashy tricks that entertain audiences.

name: Beggar
description: Wherever there is poverty, there are beggars.

name: Bodyguard
description: Hired to protect someone famous or powerful, bodyguards use intimidation, quick wits, and martial skill to keep their charges safe.

name: Bosun
description: A ship's boatswain, or bosun, leads the deckhands who maintain the ship.

name: Bounty Hunter
description: Bounty hunters are constantly on the move, whether within city walls or the wilderness, trailing their fugitive quarries for capture… or disposal.

name: Burglar
description: Burglars specialize in breaking and entering to rob homes and businesses.

name: Captain of the Guard
description: The captain of the guard leads a troop of soldiers who serve as security forces for a powerful individual, most often a high-ranking noble or very rich merchant, though this stat block could also represent a lower-ranking captain of the guard for the leader of a nation.

name: Charlatan
description: Charlatans use pretense and misdirection to swindle money and other valuables from the credulous and confused.

name: Charming Scoundrel
description: This handsome gnome sports an impressive coiffure and a flashy costume that catches the eye.

name: Chronicler
description: Exploration means very little if no account of the details exist.

name: Commoner
description: Though not every commoner is downtrodden, many live hard lives of toil as they work to keep their families fed and housed in relative comfort.

name: Cult Leader
description: A career of mystical accomplishments combined with a lifetime of subterfuge and intimidation has elevated this occultist to a powerful position.

name: Cultist
description: Excessively zealous, a cultist finds exalted purpose in their sect.

name: Dancer
description: Dance can be used to tell stories, share emotions, provide entertainment, and display a performer's athletic ability.

name: Demonologist
description: Demonologists can pull a creature from the Abyss and bend it to their will.

name: Despot
description: Despots live to amass and exploit power over others.

name: Dockhand
description: Working to load and unload cargo from ships, dockhands are considered unruly, but many stay focused and work hard until the job is done.

name: Drunkard
description: Every tavern has one—that person who drinks a little too much and starts a fight.

name: Executioner
description: Executioners carry out sentences from cruel tyrants and legitimate rulers alike.

name: False Priest
description: Belief is perhaps the strongest force in the universe, driving many to great heights.

name: Farmer
description: Workers of the fields, vineyards, and orchards of the world, farmers are known for their rugged endurance and their skill with both plants and animals.

name: Fence
description: The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught.

name: Gang Leader
description: Cutthroats, killers, thieves, and toughs prey upon the vulnerable of society.

name: Grave Robber
description: Many cultures have a tradition of burying their dead with a selection of the deceased's most precious possessions, and some include gifts that are thought to provide a boon in the afterlife.

name: Gravedigger
description: An often-overlooked group of laborers, gravediggers have a reputation for being as quiet and grim as their workplace.

name: Guard
description: Guards are rank-and-file members of a town watch or city guard, trained to look for trouble, take down criminals, and follow orders.

name: Guide
description: Guides bring travelers, tourists, and adventurers into the wondrous natural world, using their expertise to avoid deadly monsters and gruesome hazards.

name: Guildmaster
description: In cities, artisans working in a common trade often form guilds to set standards of quality, establish common prices, engage in collective bargaining with business owners, and lobby local governments for favorable laws.

name: Harbormaster
description: There are three flows important to any port: the seaward and coastal flows, marked by the rise and fall of the tides, and the flow of trade.

name: Harrow Reader
description: A harrow deck is a set of 54 cards with symbolic illustrations that serves as a sacred divining tool.

name: Hellknight Armiger
description: This menacing dwarf wears a suit of armor emblazoned with the symbol of her Hellknight order, and she wields a mighty flail.

name: Hellknight Paravicar
description: Face covered by a menacing helm and body clad in ornate plate, this figure projects an aura of immutable authority.

name: Hunter
description: As is reflected in the many depictions of an elk-headed Erastil, god of the hunt, the hunter is very much a creature of the forest, known by the forest and familiar with every aspect of it.

name: Innkeeper
description: The sight of an inn is a welcome one to any weary traveler.

name: Jailer
description: A jailer's primary responsibility is to keep prisoners from escaping.

name: Judge
description: These magistrates have the final say on the intent and spirit of the law.

name: Librarian
description: Keepers of knowledge, librarians document discoveries, events, and laws.

name: Mage for Hire
description: Not all mercenaries sell brawn and intimidating glares.

name: Mastermind
description: Masterminds weave long-ranged plots to see their nefarious goals come to fruition, deftly manipulating those around them, and turning enemies into friends and then pitting them against one another.

name: Merchant
description: Small settlements can typically support one or two generalist merchants, and larger cities house multiple specialists—experts in one type of product.

name: Miner
description: Miners explore deep underground in search of minerals and rare materials, taking numerous precautions to keep themselves safe.

name: Monster Hunter
description: Some mercenaries eschew the complications of politics, oaths of service, and fealty and just get paid to hunt monsters.

name: Navigator
description: A navigator uses celestial bodies and shipping lanes to determine routes.

name: Necromancer
description: Defiling the natural order and spitting in the face of convention, the necromancer remains dutifully committed to understanding what forces await beyond the mortal boundaries of life and death.

name: Noble
description: Envied by many and detested by still others, nobles exude confidence and gentility.

name: Palace Guard
description: Every palace has its gatekeepers.

name: Pathfinder Field Agent
description: This half-elf woman looks dressed to travel anywhere and prepared for any eventuality she might find along the way.

name: Pathfinder Venture-Captain
description: The barnacle-crusted armor of this dwarf hints at a thousand exciting tales.

name: Physician
description: The art of medicine is a blend of the intellectual and the practical, concerned with how diseases work and how to prevent them.

name: Pirate
description: These scourges of the seas are a threat to anyone who spends time away from land.

name: Plague Doctor
description: These healers, often seen wearing distinctive masks and burning powders to defend against airborne plagues, are as much feared as they are respected.

name: Poacher
description: Some forests are protected by kings, others only by wild things.

name: Priest
description: Cloistered priests safeguard their temples and communities.

name: Prisoner
description: Most who end up in a jail, dungeon, or prison are just biding their time until their imprisonment ends, trying to find ways to make it through interminable days of boredom and deprivation.

name: Privateer Captain
description: A faint crust of salt rimes the coattails of this mariner, and her steely eyes gaze from beneath the brim of her tricorne hat.

name: Prophet
description: The gods occasionally send messages in dreams to individuals who wander the lands, gaining followers with their oratorical abilities.

name: Rain-Scribe
description: This sharp-eyed half-elf wears weather-beaten gear that would easily blend in with any natural terrain, and carries an elaborately carved walking staff.

name: Reckless Scientist
description: It's the reckless scientist's job to break the rules of reality, no matter the cost.

name: Ruffian
description: Using their strength to bully others into submission, ruffians often work as bodyguards and enforcers for powerful criminals like charlatans and fences.

name: Saboteur
description: Saboteurs excel at infiltration, using it to perform destructive acts, whether they are the physical destruction of a valuable object or obstructing important political proceedings.

name: Sage
description: The greatest knowledge comes from experience.

name: Servant
description: Maids, butlers, and majordomos alike, servants are skilled at keeping a home in working order and protecting the interests of their employers.

name: Server
description: Always on the move from patron to patron, servers are the backbone of any tavern or eatery.

name: Ship Captain
description: The captain is the ultimate authority on a vessel, responsible for the livelihood and well-being of everyone on the ship.

name: Smith
description: Most smaller communities have at least one smithy where locals and travelers can have horses shod or equipment repaired.

name: Spy
description: No empire would be complete without its spies.

name: Surgeon
description: The surgeon specializes in the physical alteration of the body to prevent the spread of disease, removing necrotic and decaying flesh to help the whole to survive.

name: Tax Collector
description: Ledgers and marks, positive and negative flows, and levies and allotments are a tax collector's daily bread.

name: Teacher
description: The passing of knowledge and traditions from generation to generation is a time-honored occupation.

name: Tempest-Sun Mage
description: A wooden mask carved with a stoic leopard's features covers the face of this scholar.

name: Tomb Raider
description: Great treasure awaits those willing to explore the hazardous depths of the world's ancient tombs and forgotten dungeons.

name: Torchbearer
description: Torchbearers carry a light sources for seasoned explorers and serve as apprentices.

name: Tracker
description: The forest offers dangerous creatures—whether they walk on four legs or two—a place to hide.

name: Troubadour
description: Troubadours keep alive the traditional songs of their cultural and write original works to commemorate major events.

name: Urchin
description: Although their escapades might be notorious, few urchins are thrill-seekers.

name: Veteran Reclaimer
description: This grizzled half-orc wields a longbow with the familiarity of a woman who considers it more as an extension of her body than a weapon.

name: Virtuous Defender
description: With his well-worn plate armor and mighty shield, this tall figure appears ready to stand against any foe.

name: Warden
description: Wardens are the chief guardians of borders and frontiers.

name: Watch Officer
description: Watch officers are assigned to a certain area within a city or community.

name: Zealot
description: Zealots ferret out plots against their religion and seek justice for their church's followers.
